lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/lebron.Lebron.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run lebron.Lebron.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Main class for the LeBron chatbot, a task tracking system.
* This class coordinates the lebron.storage.Storage, lebron.ui.Ui, lebron.parser.Parser and lebron.tasklist.TaskList to process user commands.
* Initialises the chatbot with the necessary components and loads data from the file.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are saved.
ui.showError("Couldn't load previous legacy. Starting fresh.");
* Starts the main execution loop of the chatbot.
* Continuously reads user input and executes the corresponding commands until exit.
ui.showMessage("Here's how your legacy list is going:");
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this as done for the king:");
ui.showMessage("Ok, I've marked this as not done yet. Keep grinding:");
ui.showMessage("Noted. I've benched this task and removed it from the rotation:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list. #StayReady");
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your legacy");
throw new LebronException("Hol' up... I don't know what '" +
ui.showError("I couldn't save your legacy to the disk!");
* Displays a confirmation that a task has been successfully added.
* @param task The task that was added.
ui.showMessage("That's what's up king! I've added this to the legacy:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list. #StayReady");
* Represents exceptions specific to the LeBron chatbot.
* Used to signal invalid inputs during command execution.
* Constructs a new lebron.LebronException with a specific error message.
* @param message The detailed error message describing the invalid input.
* Decodes user input strings into meaningful commands and task objects.
* Validates the format of commands and throws exceptions for illegal inputs.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");

* Handles the loading and saving of task data onto a hard disk.

* Uses toFileFormat() from each task to create the text line.

* An abstract representation of a task in the LeBron system.
* Encapsulates the description and completion status of a task.

* @param description The text describing the task.
* Returns "X", representing the completion status of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, and a blank space otherwise.

* Reads the next line of input from the user.

System.out.println("That's all from your boy from Akron, Ohio");
